results.title: Irma Vep
results.creator_credit: Dacia Films, Georges Benayoun and Olivier Assayas
results.brief_description: Irma Vep is a charming comedy about the art of filmmaking. When Hong Kong movie star Maggie (Maggie Cheung playing herself) comes to make a film in Paris with French director Rene Vidal(Jean-Pierre Leaud) she has little idea of the maelstrom she is entering. Despite the stresses of being in a strange city with a minimum grasp of the French language, Maggie implicitly believes in her director’s vision. His long-suffering crew, however, do not and when Rene is overcome with the symptoms of a nervous breakdown it seems the film is set for a disasterous outcome. Despite this, “Irma Vep” ends on a magical note as the mysterious director manages to create his vision despite the circumstances of the film-making process. In this fun ‘mockumentary’ Oliver Assayas cryptically comments on the art of filmmaking as well as on the French film industry (and the Hong Kong film phenomenon). Ultimately “Irma Vep” is a vehicle for and a tribute to Hong Kong movie star Maggie Cheung, whose brave performance grounds the whole film. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Irma La Douce
results.creator_credit: Mirisch Corporation, Edward Alperson, Billy Wilder and Orry-Kelly
results.brief_description: Comedy set in the red-light district of Paris, where Irma La Douce (Shirley MacLaine) is a “working girl”. A naive gendarme (Jack Lemmon) falls for the beautiful Irma after conducting a one-man raid on a notorious backstreet establishment. He becomes Irma’s “business manager” but soon becomes insanely jealous of her clientele and in despair, devises a clever way to keep her all to himself. MacLaine and Lemmon display their impressive comic talents under Billy Wilder’s direction. This screen adaptation was based on the successful Broadway musical.

results.title: Irene
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Imperadio Pictures and Herbert Wilcox
results.brief_description: Based on American playwright James Montgomery’s book of the same name written in 1919, and a remake of the 1926 silent hit, this romantic musical comedy stars Anna Neagle in the lead role of Irene, a poor young Irish girl working in New York and her subsequent involvement with two wealthy men vying for her affection. Stars Ray Milland, Alan Marshal, Roland Young, Billie Burke.

results.title: Iraq my country: an exiles return to Samawa
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Film Camp, SBS Independent, Philippa Campey and Hadi Mahood
results.brief_description: Director Hadi Mahood returns to his hometown of Samawa, in the Shiite south of Iraq, after 14 years living in Australia, where he fled as a refugee from Sadam Hussein. Mahood wants to see for himself, and record, how the 2003 invasion and subsequent occupation of Iraq have affected his country and people. Through interviews and observation, the documentary explores the conditions of life in Samawa, and its peoples’ hopes and fears for the future.

results.title: Irania (Vol. 2): Glory of the Past (PC)
results.brief_description: Irania (vol. 2) covers the ancient Persian history, from the 3rd millenium B.C to the 7th century A.D. From the eruption of the industrious Elamite empire until the final eclipse of the Sasanids, each era is richly illustrated with an historical essay, a photo gallery and video clips. The CD-Rom is divided into four distinct periods: Elamite, Medean, Achaemenian, Seleucid and Sasanid empires, and contains in addition to these an art exhibit titled, ‘Ancient treasures’, with artworks and handicraft dating back as far as the 5th millenium B.C. to 7th century A.D. Well-known highlights include; Pasargardae (tomb of Cyrus the Great), ancient Ecbatane, Takht-e Jamshid (Persepolis), and the Sasanid tombs of Naqsh-e Rustam with their Zoroastrian iconography. To navigate, direct the pointer to the icons on the right-hand side of the screen. Each screen is divided in 4 sections: Photo or video, transcript of commentary, related topics and history. Each section is fully searchable and can be printed. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC or compatible with 486 or higher processor, CD-Rom drive, audio board, speakers and SVGA resolution monitor with 256 colors or higher, 8 MB of RAM, at least 10 MB hard drive space, Windows 95 or later. Includes narration in English and in Farsi.

results.title: Irania (Vol. 1): Islamic Era (PC)
results.brief_description: Irania (vol. 1) covers Iran’s Islamic era, from 7th century A.D. to the present days. The information in this volume is divided into seven categories: mosques and theological faculties, pavilions and gardens, mausolea and tombs, natural vistas, holy shrines, nomads of Irans, other historical sites. Highlights include Esfahan with the Blue Mosque, the Bazaar and the famous bridges doubling as tea houses, the Eram garden in Shiraz and the citadel of Bam. Viewers familiar with Iranian films, such as ‘Gabbeh’ will find comprehensive information on the Ghashghaie tribe of the Fars province. Irania presents 350 monuments through 3000 pictures, video clips as well as historical information, a timeline and maps. Each section is fully searchable and can be printed. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC or compatible with 486 or higher processor, CD-Rom drive, audio board, speakers and SVGA resolution monitor with 256 colors or higher, 8 MB of RAM, at least 10 MB hard drive space, Windows 95 or later. Includes narration in English and in Farsi.

results.title: Iran Adrift in a Sea of Blood
results.brief_description: This program looks at the social fabric of Iranian society, focusing on the strength of religious fervour and the concept of martyrdom. It explains how the country has sustained its war with Iraq for over six years at a cost of half a million casualties.
